sections.purpose: To provide precise temperature control for incubation and heating of samples.
sections.scope: Applicable to analytical assays in Pharmaceutical Analysis.
procedure: Fill the bath with distilled water up to the required level.
Set the desired temperature on the thermostat and power ON.
Wait for the water to reach and stabilize at the set temperature.
Place samples in the racks and submerge them in the water.
Maintain the lid closed to ensure temperature uniformity.
Remove samples after the required time and turn OFF the power.
Drain and clean the bath regularly to prevent scaling.
precautions: Never operate the heating element without water.
Do not use the water bath for temperatures above 95Â°C.
Use distilled water to avoid mineral deposits.
Avoid splashing water on the control panel.
Wait for the water to cool before draining.
